sequence:
My Fond Memories

<size=45>Chapter 2: The Meaning of Glory</size>

scripts.say: I was simply speaking from a logical perspective. After all, we have a higher chance of victory if we face them in a night battle rather than facing them head-on.
Enough already, you're dragging the Royal Navy's Glory through the mud by ignoring the position of allies that have requested for help, are you not?!

Exeter, aren't you the one getting carried away by putting too much emphasis on "Glory"? Splitting our allied forces up like that, are you planning on fighting the enemy's main fleet by yourself? Though, if that's what you were going for, I wouldn't have stopped you~♪
As always, Exeter and Ajax were quarreling with each other.

Ajax's battle plans were surprisingly logical and accurate. That said, because she prioritized logic over all else, it appeared that she wasn't able to meet eye-to-eye with girls who prioritized honor or formalities.
Grr...! There's no point in arguing about this any further. I'll just follow the Commander's plans when it's time!
Are you running away? Or should I say, making an honorable retreat?
As one was bound to get more worked up the more the opponent rebutted one's argument, oftentimes the situation would get more and more tangled up...
I apologized properly to Exeter, since this is just what always happens.
Since Exeter is the kind of person who won’t listen even if you try to persuade her, is it not faster to anger her and then make her cave in, rather than explaining to her for days on end?

options.content: Even if that's the case, you don't have to mess with her so much...

scripts.say: Well, that's also because my plans rely on you to come in there to deal the finishing blow~♪
My, it appears that you do not support my actions, even though I am the secretary ship. Quite commendable, Commander.
Even though you're usually so gentle, you can act like a proper commander when it counts.
... And that's why I like you. Hehe~♪
